title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 12 February 2016 - XWiki
content:

11:17 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
11:27 <vmassol> @acotiuga: hi  
11:27 <vmassol> could you please indicate some version too  
11:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:44 <vmassol> that's not correct acotiuga  
11:44 <vmassol> :)  
11:44 <vmassol> it cannot be since 7.4  
11:44 <vmassol> nor 6.4  
11:44 <inge\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <vmassol> it's since 7.4.2, right?  
11:45 <vmassol> and 6.4.8  
11:45 <vmassol> ?  
11:45 <acotiuga> The fixes are applied to 6.4.x and 7.4.x  
11:45 <vmassol> yes so not 7.4 and not 6.4 that's wrong  
11:45 <vmassol> again it should be since 7.4.2 and since 6.4.8  
11:46 <vmassol> if I install 7.4 I won't have it!  
11:46 <inge\_> Hey, i'm trying to follow the tutorial at http://rendering.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/GettingStarted by putting that code in a unit test, but i'm getting this exception org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Failed to lookup component [org.xwiki.rendering.internal.converter.DefaultConverter] identified by [role = [interface org.xwiki.rendering.converter.Converter] hint = [default]] , does anyone know why?  
11:46 <vmassol> Hi Inge-  
11:47 <vmassol> that component is in xwiki-rendering-api  
11:47 <vmassol> but look at the root error  
11:47 <acotiuga> vincent:  subscriber will be only in 6.4.8 in the old api and replaced by subscriberReference in 7.4.2  
11:48 <vmassol> yes  
11:49 <vmassol> let me finish it  
11:49 <inge\_> Okay, the root-exception is Caused by: org.xwiki.component.manager.ComponentLookupException: Can't find descriptor for the component [role = [interface org.xwiki.configuration.ConfigurationSource] hint = [default]]  
11:49 <vmassol> acotiuga: you have the lock  
11:50 <vmassol> Inge-: hmm  
11:50 <vmassol> we should provide a default CS in commons actually  
11:51 <vmassol> right now our default impl is located in ./xwiki-platform-configuration/xwiki-platform-configuration-default/src/main/java/org/xwiki/configuration/internal/DefaultConfigurationSource.java  
11:51 <vmassol> so right now you need to provide a component impl ConfigurationSource  
11:51 <vmassol> its a bug from our side  
11:51 <vmassol> would be nice to raise a jira issue  
11:52 <vmassol> unless I'm mistaken. tmortagne: do you confirm?  
11:53 <tmortagne> inge\_, vmassol: you can use ConfigurationSourceProvider  
11:53 <vmassol> I don't think so  
11:53 <vmassol> that's in an existing component impl  
11:54 <vmassol> converter  
11:54 <vmassol> default converer I mean  
11:54 <tmortagne> @Inject  
11:55 <tmortagne> ha ok did not read the whole chat  
11:55 <vmassol> tmortagne: from what I understand the question is not how to fix the code but that it's not working  
11:55 <tmortagne> so yes rendering should use the provider  
11:56 <tmortagne> in the meantime all your can do is provide a default configuration source  
11:56 <vmassol> a jira issue would be nice, we can fix it easily  
11:57 <vmassol> I was going ti say we should improve our rendering standalone tests but I think we dropped that module ;)  
11:58 <tmortagne> inge\_: the easiest is to extends VoidConfigurationSource in your configuration source  
11:58 <tmortagne> no need for standalone tests, any rendering unit test should have cough this  
11:59 <vmassol> we have plenty of rendeirng unit tests and they didn't catch it  
11:59 <tmortagne> it means we don't test the converter or we provided a default configuration source mock in the test withough thinking about it  
11:59 <tmortagne> we don't have many test on converter  
11:59 <vmassol> that's whay I mean, we can never be guaranteed that it works unless you have functional tests  
11:59 <vmassol> s/you/we  
12:00 <tmortagne> in that case it's the unit test that was badly written (if there is any unit test)  
12:00 <vmassol> a unit test will never ensure that anything works at runtime  
12:00 <tmortagne> a rendering unit test should not mock things that are provided only in platform  
12:01 <tmortagne> of course but this specific issue should have been noticed in a unit test  
12:01 <vmassol> basically the examples from the doc should be located in functional tests to ensure they work always  
12:02 <vmassol> if we care about rendering working in standalone mode  
12:02 <inge\_> Okay, thanks. I'll try to extend VoidConfigurationSource  
12:03 <tmortagne> (and don't forget to register your new component in components.txt)  
12:03 <vmassol> btw if we don't mock the deps, it means it's an integration test and func test or integration tests are the same (basicalyl ensuring that different pieces of code work together) so we're saying the same thing in the end ;)  
12:05 <inge\_> I'm just doing some exploratory testing, so I'll just have to register it with the EmbeddableComponentManager, right?  
12:05 <vmassol> yes  
12:06 <vmassol> you don't need components.txt nor annotations for that  
12:06 <vmassol> (if you're doing explicit runtime registration against the CM)  
12:19 <Inge-> whoa. Another Inge.  
12:26 <msmeria1> but which one is the real one? :)  
12:26 <msmeria1> is now known as <msmeria>  
12:27 <vmassol> Inge-: ah thought it was you :)  
12:31 <inge\_> I'm new here.  
12:31 <inge\_> :)  
12:32 <inge\_> Registering VoidConfigurationSource with the CM worked wonders btw  
12:33 <vmassol> cool  
12:35 <Inge-> Everyone from Norway is called Inge on IRC...  
12:35 <vmassol> :)  
12:55 <vmassol> acotiuga: I still don't see the doc at http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki80M2 ?  
12:55 <vmassol> you should put it here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki80M2#HMiscellaneous-1  
13:14 <Pbas> has quit  
13:14 <acotiuga> Should I add the link to the jira issue fixed or a description of the fix?  
14:00 <vmassol> acotiuga: to the description in the reference documentation  
14:00 <vmassol> I'd put a link on "new binding" to the ref doc  
14:00 <vmassol> the style is also wrong, fixing  
14:18 <vmassol> yep you need the wiki ;)  
14:18 <vmassol> no +  
14:18 <vmassol> it's a space!  
14:18 <vmassol> a referece doesn't have any "+" for spaces :)  
14:18 <vmassol> (acotiuga)  
14:19 <vmassol> acotiuga: you shoul use preview before saving as much as possible  
14:19 <vmassol> \*should  
14:19 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Pong  
14:20 <vmassol> sdumitriu: hi thanks fore replying. It was about the blog app that we're going to move out of the core into contrib  
14:20 <vmassol> we're looking for an owner for it. I've mentioned that in an email  
14:21 <vmassol> this thread: http://markmail.org/message/vqll2cgzudiqa6y2  
14:21 <sdumitriu> Hm, I'd be a terrible maintainer  
14:21 <sdumitriu> With my lack of time  
14:22 <sdumitriu> But sure, I can be the official maintainer if nobody else wants to  
14:22 <vmassol> my guess is that the next person who actively work on the blog app will become the lead  
14:22 <vmassol> but in the mentime we put you  
14:22 <vmassol> \*meantime  
14:22 <vmassol> WDYT?  
14:23 <vmassol> s/my guess/the strategy I envision  
14:25 <sdumitriu> OK, sounds good  
14:26 <vmassol> ok thanks, will do when I move the module  
14:26 <vmassol> acotiuga: have you updated the jira issue?  
14:27 <vmassol> just checked, the answer is no. Doing it  
14:27 <vmassol> done  
14:36 <vmassol> acotiuga: you've removed the link!  
14:36 <vmassol> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki80M2#HMiscellaneous-1  
14:37 <vmassol> adding it....  
14:37 <vmassol> ah you have the lock  
14:37 <acotiuga> It was correct, that's why  
14:37 <vmassol> [[new binding>>extensions:Extension.Watchlist Application||anchor='HAdministrators:CustomizingtheWatchListemailtemplate']] probably  
14:52 <vmassol> guys, FYI I'm going to release version 0.1 of the demo flavor and install it on playgroundtemplate and then playground  
15:08 <msmeria> has quit  
15:09 <inge\_> has quit  
15:10 <vmassol> good to see it going in this direction :)  
15:10 <acotiuga> has quit  
16:10 <vmassol> mflorea: are you ok to be the next RM, for 8.0M2?  
16:10 <vmassol> (http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/)  
16:10 <vmassol> (I mean will you have time?)  
16:11 <mflorea> yes, but it needs to be done on 19th of Frebruary the latest  
16:11 <vmassol> 8.0M2 is planned for the 22nd  
16:11 <vmassol> you're on holidays after the 19th?  
16:11 <mflorea> yes, 1 week  
16:11 <vmassol> hmmm  
16:12 <mflorea> 22 is Monday  
16:12 <vmassol> I doubt we'll be ready and it's too risky IMO  
16:12 <vmassol> next in line is Edy  
16:13 <vmassol> Enygma`: would you be ok to switch with Marius?  
16:15 <mflorea> if it is planned for 22 the build should be fine on 19th so it's not a big difference, but it depends if there is work left to do that needs to be included in 8.0M2  
16:15 <vmassol> it's not a big diff except you won't be there to release on the 22 or 23rd if delayed  
16:15 <vmassol> yes  
16:15 <mflorea> we shouldn't delay :)  
16:15 <vmassol> agreed  
16:16 <vmassol> that's why I would like that the RM starts syncing everyone  
16:16 <mflorea> it would be a first to release earlier :P  
16:16 <vmassol> so that we're ready around mid next week  
16:16 <vmassol> yeah indeed  
16:16 <vmassol> well  
16:16 <vmassol> earlier is easy  
16:16 <vmassol> earlier with the rodamp done is another matter :)  
16:16 <mflorea> sure :)  
16:16 <vmassol> and we're a bit late on the roadmap side  
16:16 <vmassol> uprgade tools  
16:17 <vmassol> NS work  
17:15 <evalica> has quit  
17:49 <mflorea> has quit  
17:51 <woshilapin> Shouldn't we have xwiki-commons-extension-handler-jar and xwiki-platform-extension-handler-xar as dependencies of xwiki-commons-extension-repository-xwiki?  
17:52 <woshilapin> Maybe not xar because it's commons... but at least jar, does it make any sense?  
17:52 <woshilapin> Because without them, the Extension Manager is installed but nothing can be installed  
17:56 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:59 <tmortagne> woshilapin: I don't really agree, jar and xar are just two types of extensions and xwiki-commons-extension-repository-xwiki is more generic than that  
18:00 <woshilapin> So xwiki-commons-extension-repository-xwiki is unusable by itself, right?  
18:01 <woshilapin> Anyway, I guess it's more of a design choice here  
18:03 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:05 <vmassol> they could be made <optional> deps  
18:06 <vmassol> (don't know much about those modules)
